examples: First, there’s the study of individual sounds in spoken languages, or handshapes in signed languages, which is called phonetics.
These carry both symbolic and phonetic meanings.
In this episode, we’ll continue with phonetics, looking at vowels and how they’re represented in the IPA!
We can sing them this way because, in phonetic terms, vowels are made without closing the vocal tract just by subtly changing the shape of the tongue so that the air comes out differently instead.
In these past two episodes, we’ve been focusing on how people make sounds, which is the branch of phonetics known as articulatory phonetics.
words.defineEn: of or relating to speech sounds
words.defineVi: của hoặc liên quan đến âm thanh lời nói

examples: First, there’s the study of individual sounds in spoken languages, or handshapes in signed languages, which is called phonetics.
These carry both symbolic and phonetic meanings.
In this episode, we’ll continue with phonetics, looking at vowels and how they’re represented in the IPA!
We can sing them this way because, in phonetic terms, vowels are made without closing the vocal tract just by subtly changing the shape of the tongue so that the air comes out differently instead.
In these past two episodes, we’ve been focusing on how people make sounds, which is the branch of phonetics known as articulatory phonetics.
words.defineEn: of or relating to speech sounds
words.defineVi: của hoặc liên quan đến âm thanh lời nói

words.defineEn: any written symbol standing for a sound or syllable or morpheme or word
words.defineVi: bất kỳ ký hiệu bằng văn bản nào đại diện cho một âm thanh hoặc âm tiết hoặc hình vị hoặc từ

examples: These patterns, and the study of them, is known as phonology.
An appreciation for phonology is useful whatever your environment.
But unlike optical illusions, phonology is different for each of us depending on which languages we were exposed to at a young age.
Languages combine these individual sounds or handshapes into words according to specific patterns, and the study of that is called phonology.
While all languages have phonologies, the processes in signed languages have not been studied in as much detail.
words.defineEn: the branch of linguistics that focuses on the study of the sounds and sound patterns of language, including the analysis of phonemes, phonological rules, and the organization and systematic patterns of speech sounds within a particular language or languages
words.defineVi: ngành ngôn ngữ học tập trung vào nghiên cứu âm thanh và kiểu âm thanh của ngôn ngữ, bao gồm phân tích âm vị, quy tắc âm vị học, tổ chức và mô hình hệ thống của âm thanh lời nói trong một ngôn ngữ hoặc ngôn ngữ cụ thể

words.defineEn: beneath the tongue
words.defineVi: dưới lưỡi

examples: Send in the troops, aircraft, nuclear submarine experts, the whole nine yards.
I boarded the submarine.
You're a submarine.
And submarines can float on top of the water for the same reason.
That was a submarine shower.
words.defineEn: a warship that can operate both on and under water
words.defineVi: một tàu chiến có thể hoạt động cả trên và dưới nước

examples: set, submerge ship.
In this version, sailors encounter nine beautiful women atop a submerged island at sea.
And then you fully submerge 'em in the marinara.
Moose will fully submerge themselves and paddle up to 20 kilometers.
The acidity of the water acts like vinegar, pickling any submerged flesh.
words.defineEn: sink below the surface; go under or as if under water
words.defineVi: chìm dưới bề mặt; đi dưới hoặc như thể dưới nước

examples: It’s a submersible robot designed to collect data in the grounding zone.

The researchers on the Alvin submersible weren’t looking for a massive hydrothermal vent field when they were exploring a mountainous region of the Atlantic seafloor about 750 to 900 meters below the waves.
We have to discharge both of those simultaneously and maintain the drain rate of the submersible pump.
In 1998, a remotely operated submersible detected a plastic bag at 10,898 meters.
Researchers have been inspired by flying squid to create submersible robots capable of jetting out of the water in much the same way.
words.defineEn: capable of being immersed in water or functioning while submerged
words.defineVi: có khả năng được ngâm trong nước hoặc hoạt động trong khi ngập nước

examples: I think that's rated for submersion, isn't it? -
words.defineEn: the act of wetting something by submerging it
words.defineVi: hành động làm ướt một cái gì đó bằng cách nhấn chìm nó

examples: Please welcome Calibre 50.
words.defineEn: a degree or grade of excellence or worth
words.defineVi: một mức độ hoặc lớp xuất sắc hoặc giá trị

examples: Also the screen is calibrated from the factory.
Additionally, the Y-shaped layout was specifically calibrated to minimize local wind forces.
Depending on the distance to its target, the archerfish can calibrate, changing the shape and speed of its spit.
Okay, here's the deal, his brain is calibrated for the spectral cues off of his shaped ear.
We can actually calibrate cameras up to 3000 C, which is almost 6000 degrees Fahrenheit to measure the temperature of NASA's latest nuclear electric engine.
words.defineEn: make fine adjustments or divide into marked intervals for optimal measuring
words.defineVi: thực hiện các điều chỉnh tốt hoặc chia thành các khoảng được đánh dấu để đo tối ưu

examples: The politician was accused of being economical with the truth.
They accused the government of riding roughshod over international law.
The suspect has been accused of setting the restaurant on fire.
He was accused of dishonestly obtaining property.
She was accused of taking bribes.
words.defineEn: to claim that someone has done something wrong
words.defineVi: để tuyên bố rằng ai đó đã làm điều gì đó sai

examples: The envious politician attacked his opponent with baseless accusations, not realizing that envy shoots at others and wounds itself, as his own reputation was tarnished in the process.
As for the groundless accusations of certain Western media, I can only say that they are measuring other people's corn by their own bushel.
You're only playing into your accusers' hands by making accusations in return.
Before you make those accusations, you better have all of your ducks in a row.
Even though the successful businessman was facing false accusations, a good name keeps its luster in the dark, and his reputation remained untarnished.
words.defineEn: a formal charge of wrongdoing brought against a person; the act of imputing blame or guilt
words.defineVi: cáo buộc chính thức về hành vi sai trái chống lại một người; hành động đổ lỗi hoặc cảm giác tội lỗi

examples: Apparently, the Middle East is very bereft of cloud computing and data centers, and so they're in talks with Amazon to bring a data center to the Red Sea Coast, and I wouldn't be surprised if some sort of deal is announced very soon.
words.defineEn: (of people) feeling very lonely and sorrowful, particularly as a result of a loss
words.defineVi: (của mọi người) cảm thấy rất cô đơn và buồn bã, đặc biệt là do mất mát

words.defineEn: deprive through death
words.defineVi: tước đoạt qua cái chết

examples: The measures are irrelevant as far as inflation is concerned.
She deliberately muddied the waters by constantly referring to other irrelevant cases.
Some thought the elderly woman's critiques of society were outdated and irrelevant, but an old dog barks not in vain, for experience brings valuable perspective.
Even the origins of relatively new words quickly become irrelevant.
All other context should be irrelevant.
words.defineEn: unimportant or having no connection with something
words.defineVi: không quan trọng hoặc không có kết nối với một cái gì đó

examples: Thales was not, however, irreligious.
words.defineEn: hostile or indifferent to religion
words.defineVi: thù địch hoặc thờ ơ với tôn giáo

words.defineEn: impossible to repair, rectify, or amend
words.defineVi: không thể sửa chữa, khắc phục hoặc sửa đổi

examples: Rather than help us communicate with otherworldly beings, I see the key role of art in space as helping us to learn about ourselves, and our irrepressible drive to bring art with us wherever we go.
words.defineEn: impossible to repress or control
words.defineVi: không thể kìm nén hoặc kiểm soát

words.defineEn: free of guilt; not subject to blame
words.defineVi: thoát tội; không chịu trách nhiệm
